item.title: Aliquam
item.description: title: “Gapminder.md” output: html_document knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE) R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

item.title: Hillary vs. Trump
item.description: 2016 California Contributors (R Code) This was a project that we created during our course to understand the difference in contribution received (in $) b/w Hillary and Trump in 2016. The graphs illustrate the top 10 cities (in California) from where Hillary and Trump recieved their contributions from. The R code is as shown below: We started by importing the California contributors dataset, the zip code data base and merged both datasets.

item.title: Top 25 consumers of wine
item.description: title: “WineConsumption.md” output: html_document knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE) knitr::opts_chunk$set( message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, tidy=FALSE, # display code as typed size="small") # slightly smaller font for code options(digits = 3) # default figure size knitr::opts_chunk$set( fig.width=6.75, fig.height=6.75, fig.align = "center" ) library(tidyverse) # Load ggplot2, dplyr, and all the other tidyverse packages library(mosaic) library(ggthemes) library(lubridate) library(fivethirtyeight) library(here) library(skimr) library(janitor) library(vroom) library(tidyquant) Where Do People Drink The Most Beer, Wine And Spirits?

item.title: Hello R Markdown
